CatDescriptText: Samuel Yates, 224 N. Euclid Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "They should have the right to relocate there if they desire to do so and if they have the proper business."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Samuel Yates wearing overcoat, dark sweater, moustache, and dark hat, standing in front of store window displaying cameras, sign inscribed "triangle camera", and neon sign inscribed "cameras films developed"
